epd_metadata.epd_owner_address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.general_use: General use concrete (Including: Footpaths, slabs, foundations, normal class concrete)
product_description.classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail
product_description.hazardous_substances: None of the products contain substances listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options (modules A4-A5), modules C1-C4 and module D
lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified (scope is cradle to delivery)
lca_information.time_representativeness: Plant data from 2022, mix data from 2023

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)
databases_and_software.note: Additional Green Star (v1.3) impact categories modelled separately based on generic processes

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m³ of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.geographic_and_temporal_representativene: Good or very good for all data sources
data_quality.background_data_timeliness: All updated within 10 years as required by PCR 2019:14

installation.operational_control: Holcim does not have operational control over installation
installation.activities_included: Pouring concrete from ready-mix truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation activities

end_of_life.control: Holcim has no control over end-of-life fate

deconstruction.process: Physical drilling and removal using hydraulic excavator

benefits_module_d.description: Environmental benefits from reuse, recovery, and recycling of deconstructed concrete
benefits_module_d.use_of_recycled_aggregate: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

targets.2030: Embodied carbon of all construction materials to be at least 40% lower
targets.2050: All new construction materials to be net zero

carbonation.description: Concrete absorbs CO2 from atmosphere over its lifetime (carbonation)
carbonation.note: Carbonation not considered in this EPD and not reflected in results

allocation_approach.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_approach.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value
allocation_approach.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted as default for secondary data and processes

additional_info.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

primary_indicators: Global warming potential (GWP-Total, GWP-Fossil, GWP-Biogenic, GWP-Luluc)
Abiotic depletion potential (elements and fossil fuels)
resource_use_parameters: Use of renewable primary energy excluding raw materials
Total use of renewable primary energy resources
Use of non-renewable primary energy resources
additional_indicators: Global warming potential excluding biogenic uptake

disclaimers: Results are relative statements and do not indicate endpoints, thresholds, safety margins or risks
Some impact categories have high uncertainties or limited experience
Ionising radiation indicator excludes nuclear accidents, occupational exposure, and radioactive waste disposal effects
references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative Guidelines (2023)
British Standards Institution EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions and PCR documents (2024)
Scientific literature on carbon footprint of Australia's construction sector

contact_information.address: Level 40/100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia

additional_info.legal_notice: This publication supersedes all previous literature on this subject. Specifications and details may change. Users must determine suitability.
